intro: Parosela cylindrica, commonly known as the slender parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Parosela cylindrica is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
